column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
What an amazing experience- we did 2 nights and had a 4 hour game drive then next day 10 hour game drive. The latter was by for the best as you have time to sit and wait for the game to appear and when they do to enjoy it. Our guide and driver was Achi and the site manager Ravi- who were absolutely fantastic. Both been with site from day 1 which was 14 yrs ago so knowledge of best spots is unbelievable. We saw leopards, sloth bears, elephants, Samba deer, loads of birds , crocodiles, water buffalo . Achi also takes great photos- if you into animals ,this is for you. 
Food- amazing and chef Promod and his team - Madawa,Chamara &Chamith were so creative. Jumbo fresh prawns on Day1 are just the best.
Accommodation is comfortable and adequate for where you are- you are separated from Block1 by an electric fence!!. Not the cheapest but the old saying- you get what you pay for. 
Thanks guys for a memorable safari experience.
Pete and Mary from Australia

column12:
Outstanding experience overall! We stayed only one night which included two safaris (evening & morning). Our guides Ravi & Achi where on definately on top of their game, we saw all we wished for, tusk elefant, leopard and even a sloth bear üòä 

The food and accommodation is also stunning with the view over the Yala NP. We enjoyed traditional Sri Lankan meals which where some of the best of the whole journey. 

We can only recommend and thank Mahesh and his team a lot üòäüòá

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: This safari experience was truly in every single way way beyond any expectation.  This is truly a luxurious safari experience but for a very reasonable price.  We did the overnight safari experience with an afternoon and morning safari.  The transportation to camp, the camp and grounds itself, our tents/cabins, the staff, the two safaris, the food, the safari leader were all absolutely perfect.  I cannot wait to come back to Sri Lanka to do a longer three day safari experience with Yala Safari Camping.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
This was an amazing experience and we would certainly return if we were to come back to Sri Lanka! First, the service is out of this world from the seeming house manager Ravi making sure everything is in order; to our excellent safari driver Achi able to find so many animals and get amazing pictures; our hiking guide Madawa, and everyone else on staff. They all strive to make this an unforgettable experience! 

The camp itself is very beautiful with the restaurant being high above the canopy overlooking the park to the 'tents' nestled in the jungle below. The large permanent tents had well working air conditioning, comfortable beds with mosquito nets, and full bathrooms with hot water. It was one of our best stays in Sri Lanka and in the middle of a national park!

The safari was incredible, we did a 2-night packages with offered us 1 half day safari and one full day safari. We saw so may amazing animal and for our full day safari Achi was out of this world. It is obvious that all the drivers seemingly work together to communicate animal sightings, but Achi just seemed to get us to the really good ones right away. He also had a really nice camera with him and shared the pictures with us when we got back! All we had were our phones. It was also great talking with Achi as we drove around.

We also had the fortune to get a short guided hike up a near-by peak the morning of our last day. That was truly a treat! Great views of the park from there and a nice way to get a little workout.

The food was also good for the breakfasts and lunches offered. They were very good at accommodating my wife being gluten free which was very much appreciated. I would say that it seemed the dinners were a little uninspiring, but still good food for what it was.

If you are looking for a luxury safari glamping experience I would highly recommend Yala Safari Camping! They truly go for their slogan: Beyond Expectations! Some of the staff even had this tattooed on their arm!
column13: Amazing service, beautiful park, excellent facilities, friendly staff.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
This place is a piece of heaven!
From the very beginning the staff was very kind and welcoming. Although we arrived late in our first day and missed our lunch, they were happy to accommodate us and move the lunch to our last day.
The food is sensational, with chef Promod cooking exceptional meals with fresh ingredients from the local market. Definitely some of the best food during our stay in Sri Lanka.
The safari tents are very spacious, comfortable and well equipped for a safari camping experience.
Not to mention the stunning views from their elevated lounge/restaurant area from which you can see the entire Yala Park.
A huge thanks to the manager Ravi and the entire team (Achi, Promod, Madawa, Chamita, Chamara, Janaka, Danu)! They definitely rose up to their slogan ‚Äúbeyond expectations‚Äù.
Sad we couldn‚Äôt stay longer but would definitely come again another time!
column13: One of the best experiences during our stay in Sri Lanka

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: Wow!!! Our stay at Yala Safari camp was the highlight of our Sri Lanka trip. I don‚Äôt even know where to begin, Ravi and his team of  staff were just incredible.  So attentive, professional and passionate about their guest having an amazing experience. The facilities, the luxe glamping tent, the stunning restaurant overlooking the most incredible view of the national park is something that everyone must experience in their life. The FOOD!! My gosh the chefs do a wonderful job of serving you the most delectable meal you have in Sri Lanka. Then there is the main reason we were there and that was the safari. Achi our safari tour guide must be one of the most experienced guides in the national park. His passion for ensuring we saw all animals we went to see was amazing, he worked hard to ensure we saw the leopard, which was possibly the most amazing experience ever. I was blown away with how close we were to the elephants, we were so close we could have touched them. Achi took his time and allowed us to spend as much time as we wanted with the animals.  Our young children will remember this experience for the rest of their lives. Put Yala Safari camp on your list!!
column13: 5 star luxe in the middle of Yala National Park

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
So firstly this really is in the middle of the bush just outside Yala Safari park , nothing to do here except do a safari which is why you book it , but we booked it and on arrival they said did we want you to go on safari as well ?! Er yes    not a single other reason why you would be here , There‚Äôs not even a pool , so of course you say yes but wow ! That is when they have you and charge you $200 per morning or afternoon safari! 
The tent is far from luxurious as it is described , it said we had a jacuzzi room , it‚Äôs just a bath sunk  into the floor ! The hotel staff and r  as need were though really good , the first lunch was excellent and then it went downhill . Our breakfast on the game drive was a cheese sandwich, a square of very dry cake and a chocolate drink - we stopped next to others who had hoppers , kottu etc . 
My partner is vegetarian and her fist lunch was also excellent , then it was almost as though she was forgotten about as her dinner was a plate of vegetables (cabbage and carrots ) , some toast and a plate of chips ! 
Oh and by the way , you must be fit and healthy as you have to climb 70 steps ftom your room to the bar, dining room, reception etc . 
Thanks to our guides though we did see leopard   , lots of elephant and other game which was after all the point of it all   Its just that we were so excited about this place from how it was ‚Äúsold‚Äù
column13: Disappointed and be warned for what you have actually booked

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We had the most amazing experience at Yala Safari Camping and for us, it was the perfect end to our Sri Lankan adventure. From the moment we arrived to the moment we had to leave, Mahesh and his team made us feel like royalty.

A special mention has to go to Achi, our Safari driver. His passion and enthusiasm for his job was evident and he made our Safari drives truly memorable. He made sure we got to see everything we wanted to see and even found time for a wild river swim after a particularly hot day on trail. 

The accommodation was extremely spacious and comfortable and provided everything that you needed after a day on the roads. We even shared our bathroom with a few frogs and lizards which added to the whole experience. 

The quality and standard of the food provided by Promod, the chef, is truly amazing especially when considering the equipment he has to work with! We were continually impressed with the taste and variety of the food on offer.

For us, this was the perfect was to finish our Sri Lankan adventure and our experience will live long in our memories.
column13: Our perfect end to our Sri Lankan adventure

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
The best stay we‚Äôve had in Sri Lanka! The location is stunning, the view from the restaurant is insane, the service is the best & the fooood wow, the best food I‚Äôve had in Sri Lanka, compliments to the chefs!

The stay is truly amazing, so peaceful, the safari was so fun and well organized (we saw a leopard). There are snacks and drinks during the safari, the guide knows all the spots to give you the best chance to see all the animals. Definitely an experience to remember!

This stay is the best choice if you are coming to Yala!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: The camp is located in the outer edge of the park with a restaurant overlooking the trees. The staff, under the orgnization of Ravi, is extremely helpful. Their outstanding knowledge of the wildlife makes all safaris an exceptional experience. We enjoyed the luxurious tent, all meals were of high quality.
column13: Great way to explore wildlife and enjoy luxury camping

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
Great views, service was amazing and the food even better.
The safari trips were great and we got see all the amazing animals up close. Our driver Achi did an excellent job!

Thank you to Ravi, Promod, Madawa, Chamith, Shiran and Chamara for the amazing stay!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column10: Note that there is a long walk down some 62 steps to get to the camp ground from reception area. You will need a certain degree of fitness.
column12:
Our experience at Yala Safari Camping was absolutely spectacular! From the moment we traveled along the bumpy track to the reception area, we were immersed in the beauty of nature and the thrill of adventure. The campsite's location, just near Yala National Park, provided the ideal base for exploring the incredible wildlife.

The tent accommodations exceeded our expectations, featuring cozy bedding and all the essential amenities. Waking up to the sounds of nature right outside our tent was truly magical.

The guided safari tours were the highlight of our stay. Our knowledgeable guide, Achi, was passionate about wildlife and shared fascinating insights about the animals and their habitats. We were lucky to see a variety of wildlife, including elephants, leopards, deer, boar, crocodiles, water buffalo, and a stunning array of birds. Each safari was an unforgettable adventure!

The camp staff were exceptional‚Äîalways friendly, welcoming, and attentive to our needs. The meals were delicious and expertly prepared, showcasing local flavors that enhanced our overall experience. Pramod is an amazing chef and produces dishes which we would pay a fortune for in Australia. Also a shout out to Chamith, Madara, Shiran, Sadaruvan and Janaka who help make create some wonderful memories and carried our heavy bags up and down the steps!!

The camp's commitment to eco-friendliness made our stay even more rewarding, allowing us to be part of an initiative that respects and preserves the natural environment.

One note for future guests: the walk from the dining and reception area to the tents involves 62 steps, which might be a consideration for anyone with mobility issues. However, I‚Äôm sure Mahesh will find a solution, as he has some great plans for the camp that will surely enhance the experience.

I highly recommend Yala Safari Camping to anyone seeking an authentic and unforgettable safari adventure. It was the perfect blend of excitement, comfort, and natural beauty. I can‚Äôt wait to return for another incredible stay!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: Stayed for 2 nights. The staff, the food, the safari trips and the accommodation, everything exceeded our expectations. Thanks to Mr Mahesh, Mr Shiran, Mr Achintha and the rest of the staff for making it a memorable experience. Also, if you are an astronomy lover, dont forget to capture the milky way as the skies are very clear late night

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
Couldn't recommend YSC more highly!

 We experienced the brilliant service and hospitality, extremely talented safari guides (a huge thank you to Mahesh who drove us for both our half days).

The food was some of the best we experienced in Sri Lanka and the hospitality of the staff made the experience all the better. Ravi and all the staff were so friendly, kind and made us feel so welcome. The tents were very comfortable and had everything one would need (including AC!).

Even without a leopard sighting we all left happy!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: Overall a great stay and great service.  My husband and I have a lot of experience doing safaris in Kenya so we had a certain expectation of our experience.  In terms of the service and the restaurant, quality of the food and the safari trip itself (we went out over three days several times and saw nine leopards!!) it was very excellent.  My only critical feedback is that the photos of the rooms are a bit deceiving.  The tent had carpet, which I had never experienced in a glamping situation, and in our opinion it would be better without it.  Other than that, we enjoyed our time with Ravi, Achi, Promod, Madawa, Sadaru and Chamith!  Thank you for a memorable trip!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: The YSC team are so unique and incredible and went out of their way to make every moment magic! One minute into arriving I also had tears in my eyes at the sheer beauty of this park. I honestly couldn‚Äôt speak more highly of this place, it was the best.
column13: Biodiversity and the best Safari team on earth!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: We stayed for 2 nights and did 3 days of fame driving. Excellent wildlife guide Achi had lots of patience with us bird and reptile watching and we were lucky enough to see leopard. The camp main area is lovely and tents are set in a lovely wooden area. The tents are huge and very comfortable but a little old and tired. Thank goodness for good air-conditioning at night as it was baking hot 38 degrees each day. But during the day the AC doesn't work meaning you couldn't relax inside your tent as it was so hot. The best part of the camp was the incredibly lovely staff and absolutely amazing food the chef prepared.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We had the most amazing experience-words cannot quite describe seeing such magnificent animals in their own habitat.
A huge thank you to Archi our incredible driver and photographer - you were brilliant.   With your skills we were so lucky to see 3 leopards over 2 days and so many other countless animals and birds. 
Also to Pramod the chef who fed us such delicious food, Chamith, Sadarutan, Madava and Mahesh - you were all so kind and nothing was too much trouble. 
Thank you so much - this was an unforgettable experience.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column10: Children under 10 may struggle in the evenings, bring entertainment and snacks for them
column12:
A once in a lifetime experience. Dining above the trees and sleeping in the jungle. We loved it. The guides were helpful as soon as we arrived (our TukTuk got stuck in the sand so they assisted) and the welcome drinks and food were delicious. They also made some
Simpler options for our children. The tent was very cool, with a mini hot tub in the floor. We did have some frogs in our room, but these were removed by staff asap.

The location is breathtaking. Really peaceful and natural beauty. They also arranged a great safari for us with drinks and breakfast included

The only thing to note (and at no fault of the hotel) is this was probably not overly suitable for our young children (ages 6 and 3). The evening meal was VERY late into the night and once it gets dark it‚Äôs very quiet and calm (we felt anxious to not let our kids spoil others evening as there is no music or lights just the moon) 

I still rate them 5 stars as for adults it‚Äôs a dream. Just be aware that for kids it‚Äôs an adventure but a late one!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We‚Äôre giving Yala Camping Safari five stars as it is excellent in its category. If you‚Äôre considering YCS it‚Äôs important to know what category this is. What you get with YCS is the best service and hospitality you can imagine, extremely talented safari guides (a huge thank you to Achi who drove us for both our half day and full day safaris), truly excellent food and an adventure that you won‚Äôt soon forget. 

We arrived around 1:00pm and were immediately treated to an amazing lunch of crab and 6 or 7 local side dish specialties. From there, we did a half day afternoon safari where we saw a jackal, monkeys, crocodile, elephants, water buffalo, dozens of peacocks (technically, peafowl), mongoose and a wide variety of other birds and creatures. Dinner that night was a barbecue out on the main deck‚Ä¶again, spectacular. Beer, wine and cocktails are included.

Our next day started around 5:00am as we did a full-day safari. More crocodiles, elephants (including some spectacular close-up viewings), three leopards, numerous water buffalo, monkeys, birds of all kinds‚Ä¶the list goes on. The park closes from noon to 2:00pm, so everybody in the park goes to a beach area on the Indian ocean. YCS prepared a delicious lunch for us, which our guide set up in a shaded area. After re-entering the park, we continued until the park closed at 6:00pm, with many more fantastic animal sightings. Just an amazing day.

If you have mobility issues or are super picky about food, this may not be a good choice. These are fairly basic tents, albeit with AC and ensuite bathrooms, located a few hundred feet down a steep rocky path from the main lodge area, and the entire camp is a 12-15 minute bumpy ride away from any paved road. The food is amazing (local cuisine, elevated) and YCS appears to be able to accommodate various dietary restrictions, but if you‚Äôre a burger and fries type person this may not be the right choice.

Ravi runs the operation and his organization and hospitality is second to none. Highly recommended if you‚Äôre looking for an amazing adventure with memories to last a lifetime.
column13: Amazing adventure with memories to last a lifetime

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We had an unforgettable two-night stay at Yala Safari Camping, where we experienced the best hospitality and warmth imaginable. The Sri Lankan food prepared by the chef, Promod, was the best we enjoyed throughout our entire trip to Sri Lanka. Each meal was a delight!

Our safari experience was absolutely thrilling, thanks to our guide and driver, Ravi. His expertise allowed us incredibly close encounters with the wildlife, including elephants that approached us of their own accord and the majestic leopards of Yala. Ravi also captured stunning photographs of our adventures, which made our evenings even more special as we reminisced about the day's experiences.

The entire team at the camp, including Achi, Madawa, Sadaru, and Chamith, made sure every aspect of our stay was perfect. We highly recommend spending some time at Yala Safari Camp to reconnect with nature and enjoy a truly personal and intimate safari experience.

Thank you to the entire team for making our stay so memorable!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column10: I‚Äôm allergic to mosquito bites, whilst there I was cautious (using bands and spray) but I didn‚Äôt get bitten and didn‚Äôt see any mosquitoes!
column12: Ravi, Mahesh and the team made this a truly unforgettable experience. My sister and I stayed for 2 nights and from start to finish we were brilliantly taken care of! The pre booked transfers into the camp went seamlessly, upon arrival we were greeted with delicious coconut water and a lunch which dreams are made of! The chef is fantastic! We enjoyed an afternoon/ evening safari where we saw elephants, deer, water buffalo, countless bird varieties and crocs! Once back in camp we enjoyed a delicious meal under the stars with cold wine and beer. Day 2 was a full day safari, with lunch served in the safari park by the ocean. We saw a leopard, a brown sloth bear and much more! On the way back to camp Ravi called ahead to have cold G&Ts ready for us. Our tent was air conditioned and fabulous! The attached bathroom and shower is a little more open to the elements and often had little frog visitors and geckos, all of which are harmless! We had fireflies lighting up the roof of the tent once night.. which was just magical. YSC is a very special place full of happy, wonderful people!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: Great experience in the wilderness. Staff are amazing, accommodating and super friendly & food delicious (cooked by Pramoth!). Highly recommend this stay.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column10: You are in the nature. Please be prepared there are animals everywhere . We also had geckos in our hut which we did not mind.
column12: We had a perfect time in YSC. Ravi, Promod (the chef), Madawa, Sadaru and Chamith made our stay in the camp very special. Surrounded by nature we enjoyed the quiet and amazing place so much. The food was very good. You can also enjoy free beer and wine which was also very nice. Achi - our safari driver was a perfect guide and he showed us all the animals. We did even see the leopard which was very exciting. Beyond expectations !

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
Where do we start! Mahesh and his team- and it IS a team effort that makes this place and whole experience even work!
From the hard working boys in the kitchen to safari driver extraordinaire, to smiling "can do anything!" Mahesh the manager. They made our 2day stay truly  unforgettable. Pick up to drop off was meticulously arranged and personalised,. On arrival greeted  with delicious hand made juice. Fine dining table service and food for lunch and dinner, which  given the unique location, is a testament to how committed they are to providing a 5star experience. Our first safari was made memorable with the sighting of the elusive leopard which there are never any guarantees of spotting, but enhanced by the dogged commitment of our driver to exploring every part of the park to facilitate the sighting.Even lunch on safari was a dining experience. 
Accommodation was magical, but do take heed  of the advice to Not! have food in your tent!! Remember you are in the jungle and little visitors will smell it and visit! 
The proverb that sums up this experience for us is:
People will forget what you say,
People will even forget what you do,
But people will never forget how you make them feel.
Thank you Mahesh and your team for making us feel so special!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column10: Avoid Mid March to Mid June. Use the time wisely in the forest and make maximum safaris. Animals are unpredictable and you never which is the next moment ....
column12:
We came to Yala specifically to spot the leopard, the most secretive big cat. We chose a stay in the wild and that's what we got. Large tented camps placed well screened from adjoining huts in the midst of the jungle. Birds, monkeys, deer all around the very campsite. Atop a rock outcrop sat the focal point of the camp. The lookout,  the lounge,  the Cafe, the restaurant, the reception all rolled into one. A jungle camp with luxuries of air-conditioning,  hot running  water etc. And the food, endless and so well prepared and served with love. Great safari trips, lots of animal spotting including the cat. 
To sum it up, kudos to Mahesh, Archi and the team. Please continue to smile and win people's hearts. 
Most recommended!!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
Everything was amazing and as advertised.
Achi was a great guide  and had an incredible eye for spotting many animals. Also very friendly and knowledgeable about all of the animals we spotted.

All of the staff, Ravi, Pramod (Chef who made incredible food and catered to all our dietary requirements), Sadavuvan, Madava and Chamith were amazing, super friendly and very helpful in getting us to where we needed to be.

The view at night is incredible looking out onto the stars and watching sunrise/sunset was fabulous.

10/10 would recommend

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
Forget about the tiger king, we met the leopard king. Our guide Yashara was amazing he found us a leopard!!!! His knowledge was incredible, he had a keen eye and really persisted in trying to find a leopard. He tracked one by following the distress calls from the macaque monkeys and spotted him in an extremely hidden spot. We had smiles ear to ear as we were the first to spot a leopard that day and had prime position. He clearly loved animals as much as us and treated them with kindness never intruding in their space or interrupting their crossings of the road. What an asset Yashara is to the company. 

We saw a leopard, elephant, hornbills, many beautifully coloured bee eaters, mongoose, spotted deer, water buffalo, giant squirrel, purple faced monkeys, macaques monkeys and a star tortoise. 

The rest of the staff at the accomodation were incredible. We were showered with kindness, smiles and service. The view from the beautifully safari themed grass huge grass hut restaurant was amazing. The food was top notch and catered to me being lactose intolerance and a vegetarian. The glamping tent was beautiful, we didn‚Äôt spend much time in there with the busy itinerary, but very much enjoyed our experience.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: My husband and I had an amazing experience at Yala Safari Camping! We did a safari in the afternoon, spent the night and did another safari in the morning. The team is absolutely incredible and very welcoming. The restaurant is stunning and the food is great! The safari itself was an unforgettable experience: we saw leopards, elephants, crocodiles, buffalos, numerous beautiful birds... The team is very knowledgeable and experienced, making you feel safe throughout. I would love to repeat it again!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
This is a review of two parts, and I'm going to start with the positives.

From the very first moment, Ravi - the manager - and his team could not do enough for us! Their service and attention were second to none and certainly some of the best I've encountered anywhere in the world. Ravi, who seems to fill multiple roles from manager, to server, to safari guide (and I'm sure more) was on hand throughout our stay. He was friendly and engaging and his animal & bird knowledge fantastic. Together with Achi the driver, he made our safari very interesting and I personally really appreciated that they stopped for the smaller things like birds as well, and didn't just go chasing after big game. That said we were beyond thrilled with our leopard sighting and being only one of 2 vehicles made it really special.

The meals provided by Promod the chef were out of this world - each meal was a literal feast starting with lunch on arrival. Dinner under the stars was a delicious BBQ and for breakfast we were given a choice of western or Sri Lankan. We opted forthe Sri Lankan and wow! What a treat!

However...

When it came to accommodation this is where I had a major issue. And not because I needed super high end luxury, but because the pictures I'd BASED my booking on, shown on the online agency Agoda, did not match up to what the reality was in any shape, way or form.
While you can tell that the accommodation may have looked like these photos once upon a time, this is certainly not the case anymore. Instead of the highly polished wood flooring in the photos, we were presented with a less than appealing carpet - a very odd choice of flooring for a bush lodge. And there were no pristine white curtains as per the photos, but rather some very old discoloured curtains hanging in front of plastic screens.¬†

I personally have a big issue with being misold something especially when paying the kind of money we did, and I also have an issue when the owner - who apparently lives locally - leaves his staff to have to deal with unhappy customers on the ground because he's not invested any money in¬† room maintenance. If there aren't funds for room maintenance then at the very least, post accurate and updated photos to your Agoda account!

All of this said the tent had air-conditioning and hot water. The linen at least was clean and bed very comfortable so we did have a great night's sleep listening to the sounds of the bush.

So while I don't appreciate being misold something, thanks to outstanding efforts from Ravi and his team on the ground I would still very much recommend staying here as the location and staff are genuinely fantastic. Just manage your expectations regarding the tents if booking through Agoda.
column13: Fantastic Staff but Online Agency Photos  Very Misleading...

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column10:
Create memories which will last a lifetime.
Back to nature camping but with hot water, air con and a bath in the room!
Exceptional food.
column12:
Fantastic time with the team at Yala Safari Camping!

I was travelling with my brother and we both wanted to maximise our chances of seeing a leopard in Yala national park, so booked a two night camping safari package. We had a few reservations before booking including the thought of camping in the wild and if the food and facilities would be ok. Our alternative would have been a more luxurious hotel nearby.

Yala safari camping exceeded all expectations. And I would highly recommend just going for it!

On arrival we had the most amazing lunch on a wooden platform overlooking vast swathes of jungle. The curry and large prawns were some of the best food of our trip in Sri Lanka.

We then visited Zone 5 in Yala where we were fortunate to see a leopard with a cub and another male at twilight. The next day we had a full day in Yala Zone 1. Again we saw a leopard and some other fantastic wildlife.

Both safari‚Äôs were in a reasonable 4x4 with a cool box with unlimited drinks and water. Lunch on the full day was a hot meal on china plates looking out over a river in Yala park. Beautiful.

The campsite is wonderfully rustic. All meals etc are served on a dedicated permanent platform area with roof etc looking over the Jungle. The dark sky at night was truly stunning with only the light of one temple in the distance to be seen. The pathways are lit by oil lamps to your ‚Äútent‚Äù and it‚Äôs truly magical.

Accommodation is in an air conditioned tent on a raised platform with a bath and hot shower. Not a 5 star hotel room but we certainly didn‚Äôt miss anything. 

Our experience was truly engaging with the wonder of nature and the team guided us expertly throughout. Thank you for an amazing experience which will last a lifetime of memories.
column13: A fabulous experience enjoying the wonders of nature in Yala National Park. You wont miss your 5 star hotel!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We had a fantastic experience at Yala Safari Camping. The place itself is wonderful and in the middle of nowhere. We were so welcomed and served sumptuous Sri Lankan food. The safari was also super cool and everything we needed was also provided here. The staff were amazing, they were so friendly, helpful and hospitable.

I highly recommend booking your safari experience here if you are visiting Yala. 

Thanks to Ravi, Achi, Promod, Madawa, Sadary and Chamith for giving us this experience.
column13: Best place and people in Yala!

column12: It's situated in a really great location by the sea and Yala national park. Very close to the park and good secluded beach is available (unfortunately rough during off season). Food was also great. But the rooms can be a bit improved as the outdoor light on the balcony had to be repaired after informed by us and the toilet was leaking. We were there for our anniversary and it was pre-requested to put up a little decoration, which was not available when we arrived. But later when we came from dinner, it was done on our bed. So the staff had entered the room with no prior notice while we were away and it was not requested by me or my husband which seemed a bit of an invasion of our privacy. Other than that the staff seemed good and the overall experience was good.

column10: The safari charge is exorbitant. Rs. 20,000 for 2 people is simple too much. Perhaps shared tours can be an option and cost effective too.
column12: The toilet malfunctioned;there was a leak in the commode and the area always had standing water which was worrisome particularly as my wife has limted mobility and a slip could have been disastrous. column12:
This was the 3rd time I‚Äôve visited the hotel and I simply can‚Äôt get enough of this place. The property and its location is absolutely amazing and mesmerising! Food was a bit subpar this time compared to last year (2023), with a lesser spread and in terms of taste, but still decent.

However, what made this visit even more memorable and special was due to Chef Indunil‚Äôs great hospitality. He truly made our stay at Jetwing Yala special this year and also last year as well. He made sure that all our needs were attended to from offering the room with the best Sea view, to personalised snacks and meals to a nice small tour around the property. He made sure that we were well taken care of, which we really appreciate given his busy schedule. Thank you Chef Indunil, you deserve a raise with your amazing customer service skills! 

Overall, we had the best time here and would be visiting again next year as well when I visit Lanka.

column12: We stayed for 2 nights while we did some safaris nearby - the room was big enough for the three of us and very comfortable with a balcony looking out at the pool and sea.  The pool is amazing - so long!  Unfortunately we were not able to swim in the sea due to very rough conditions but there is a lifeguard on duty just in case anyone was tempted.  I had a good chat with the very friendly lifegauard who I think must have been really bored given the conditions.  We had breakfast and dinner in the restaurant - great choice available and the food was very good.  The first morning we got a takeaway breakfast as we left the hotel at 5:30 and it was also very good.  The hotel is built in an open style and when it rains heavily the floors can become very slippy but the staff do their utmost to keep it safe.  We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend.

column10: Should you have any dietary needs, Speak to the chef ahead of time
column12:
A very nice place to vacation. The rooms and hotel is very clean, neat and tidy. The staff is excellent. This is our 3rd Jet wing property on our vacation. There are two areas that the hotel chain can improve on. 

- Change the hair conditioner in your washroom. It‚Äôs not effective. My wife had to use 3 bottles and yet she was not satisfied. 

- The culinary staff and the servers need to be trained on safe food handling and how to react to dietary needs of the guest. All three hotels failed in this area and only the executive chef was able to underhand accommodate us.
column13: A good hotel but training on allergens for culinary/severs  are needed.

Busy on weekends with family focus.
column12:
Very nice hotel on the rough and magical coast, a good access point to Yala national park.
Very comfortable room and expansive buffet, leaving no wishes open.
Biggest swimming pool we have ever seen. Very kind and helpful pool bartender and lifeguard. 
The coast is stunning. 
Also good for families.

column12: We had 2 fabulous days at Jetwing jungle lodge from 07th to 09th September. From the time we parked to car we were well taken care by the team at Jetwing Jungle beach until we got in to the car to leave . Food was fabulous ,  Though the meals were from  A la carte menu ,  The chef Indunil was very accommodating turn out what ever we asked for and the dishes were beyond our expectations. The best part was Sasanka , our butler . He was ever so hospitable with a  great smile and attended to all our needs , some times even at late in the evening.  we did a tour of the entire property and the efforts the management has taken to be environmentally  friendly and sustainable is commendable .  will surely visit Jet wing Jungle lodge again and will recommend highly .

column12:
Few staff could speak English- in a 5 star hotel this is surprising compared to all other places in Sri Lanka we stayed in. Because of this our check-in was confusing - the poor girl really needed someone with her with better knowledge of the hotel and room and could speak reasonable English
Not well trained- so many gaps in knowledge.
I think the team has not been well trained in customer service- 
Dinner was very poor- most of the buffet stations were not ready when opened and had to wait a long time- eg 1 hour after opening to access.
Average quality food
Our drinks at the bar were forgotten too at the bar- 3 of us got them and another was completely forgotten- no apology either.
Just a very average stay- our worst in 2 trips to Sri Lanka- given what we had heard about Jetwing this was a surprise and we won't stay with any Jetwing again given their low standards

Positives- the pool and location near Yala

column12: Room was clean, however, sofa and bed decor big pillows (brown) were not washed/shampoo washed. Due to no exhaust in the toilet or due to S traps are not flushed/maintained, sewer smell was coming in and out when no wind. Double door to the balcony was not sealed at the bottom and dust/hot air was coming to the room. Food was very average and some food that were presented outside was on wooden boxes that were wobbling. On top of that the dishes were covered with plastic covers that need to be lifted but no place to put it on. It was a complete failure in terms of food presentation (poor standards). One of the staff was rude when I questioned about the Safari prices. However, Nayomi who looked after us was excellent. Very kind and acted upon every request we made and she ensured we felt happy. Excellent service from her compared with all other staff we met and saw. I felt that some staff had different standarded to locals compared to foreifnees. However, regardless of all above, food was very average. This was the most drawback which I decided to give the average rating. Management should look after their employees and change their attitude to all customers.

column10: Choose the a-la-carte restaurant for one evening to taste Sri Lankan food but fine dining style.
column12:
Jetwing Yala is a quality hotel with high grade fixtures and fittings, some of the best beds and pillows we have experienced in any 5*, wonderful food, and service that gives some of the premium brand names a run for their money. 

It‚Äôs certainly not perfect-we arrived to a ceiling being taken apart with a hammer drill (Jetwing should be notifying clients in advance) which carried on through the afternoon. And the pool, whilst outstanding in terms of size, cleanliness and the swim up bar, needs maintenance to repair numerous missing tiles. The decision not to use cushions on sun loungers is odd and not in keeping with 5* hotels. 

But you look past all of that because it‚Äôs just a damned nice place to be. The front of house manager was always present and addressed our concerns immediately. His entire team are a credit to him and the Jetwing brand. 

And the beach-okay you can‚Äôt go swimming in monsoon season but there‚Äôs nothing stopping you sitting and watching one of the most beautiful views in the region. 

We would highly recommend this hotel. And if they do renovate the place it would be epic. 

Thank you for a wonderful couple of days!

column6: {'id': '4833492', 'name': 'Jetwing Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3042, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262004, 'longitude': 81.40938, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d4833492-Reviews-Jetwing_Yala-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingyala/', 'address': 'Jetwing Yala Rd, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Jetwing Yala Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82614'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 31, 'count2': 42, 'count3': 156, 'count4': 711, 'count5': 2102}}
column10: Go elsewhere
column12:
The place is, we are sorry to report, a total scam given the prices charged. The fotos on the jetwing yala website (of rooms, bathrooms in rooms, pool and facilities) do not match reality. At all! 

In fact, by asking staff we discovered that everything was staged 9 years ago after which they removed all the little elements that provide comfort. Mattresses on the loungers at the pool? Gone. Cushions on the balcony furniture? Gone. 
 
The place has not been maintained properly with the roof falling apart and doors not closing. The block out curtains were dirty and broken and ineffective. The doors to the balcony were broken (we changed rooms twice, same result). The bathroom has an open air connection (not advertised on the website!) so insects are everywhere plus it is steaming hot. The aircon was making huge noise but barely kept the room at a decent temperature. Bed has a plastic protection cover (?!?!) that makes you sweat. Open electricity cables everywhere. See picture. 

And that for the incredible price of the equivalent of eur 385 per night (halfboard). Per room. 

Pool area very poor with broken tiles, tired furniture and a shallow and hot pool. Guy at poolbar very friendly. Beach area worthless. Some poor fellow is guarding furniture that was deposited there 9 years ago after which nothing was done. They mention a bar is there too but I think the dunes swallowed it.  

Food quality (we did lunch and dinner a la carte after cancelling halfboard) good and reasonably priced. Good service. 

We were offered (by the gentle front office) a bottle of wine with a value of eur 30 as compensation which was a nice gesture but grossly insufficient. 

We asked by email prior to booking
1/ have you solved the insect issue. Yes. Lie 1
2/ do you have large groups. No. Lie 2
3/ do you have ongoing construction. No. Lie 3
They are working on the roof and several blocks are being refurbished. 

Shame on you Jetwing management!

PS the location is close to the yala block 1 entrance but make sure your safari company buys the online premium ticket. that gives you priority access. We were stuck as jeep #50 in a long queue eliminating the advantage of being close by

P
column13: A total scam, shame on Jetwing!

column12:
Jetwing Yala is a great location and hotel to base your visit to Yala National Park. The rooms are comfortable and have the most amazing view out over the sand dunes to the ocean. The outdoor bathroom is unique and fun, particularly if it rains and you get the chance of a shower in the shower. 
The pool is huge and in the afternoon quite often has a visit from the local family of monkeys who like to come down and get a drink.  The sea was too rough in this area to swim in so the pool was our base in the afternoon.
The food was great and had plenty of choice. The hotel also packed us a 'soft breakfast' of pastries and fruit to get us through an early morning safari until we returned for the proper buffet breakfast -  a much appreciated gesture at 5.30am!
Overall a great option for staying in the area.

column12:
I went to Jetwing Yala for a 2-night stay. The staff was very professional, extremely helpful, and warm. I would especially like to mention 4 people who went beyond the call of duty to make sure our stay was awesome.

Indunil (executive sous chef)
who made sure we were satisfied with the food. He was kind enough to accommodate our requests in the restaurant and offered us with various things to pamper us. He went above and beyond the call of duty to show us around the hotel operations. It was an eye-opener to see how much work the staff goes through to make it happen, and I have a new respect for the hotel for implementing amazing sustainable initiatives with water and electricity. He is a leader material and ambassador for the hotel.

Sachini at the reception.
She made sure rooms were ready on time and she convinced us to make it for the morning buffet after our half-day safari trip :).

Dharmasiri (Lifeguard)
He was super friendly and accompanied us, showing us around the beach area and making sure we were safe. He also briefed us about the hotel's history, seasons, sea currents, and various other info. He is also a good ambassador for the hotel and tourists. An uncut gem in the staff.

Sameera (Operations)
He is the master of all wisdom behind the scenes / operations. From electronics, electrical, to water management, he knows everything, and he is the glue of the staff and processes, and the go-to man for any technical issue. He also has an ability to describe the process like a good lecturer :).

All in all, a wonderful hotel with great staff. Oh, did I mention that the food was top-notch too? They can give a good run for the money to some of the other 5-6 star hotels. I think Indunil and team are doing a great job in the kitchen to create excellent quality food. And with warm staff in the restaurant areas, it's like icing on the cake.
Kudos to the entire team at the hotel!!

column12:
This is seriously one of the best hotels in Yala National Park to stay at. The pool is amazing and absolutely stunning. The gym has a lot of stuff to workout with such as weights and pull up stands and more! The rooms are awesome with a really nice view of the ocean. The odd numbered rooms are themed red, and the blue themed rooms are even numbered. The rooms have a smell of the dentist office for some reason. But the laundry is vey fast and nice smelling. The food at the restaurant as amazing with breakfast and dinner being buffet and lunch is a menu. 

Overall, really good resort to stay at!
column13: Best resort in Yala National Park

column12: Nice hotel located adjacent to Yala National Park. This makes it easy to get in for an early safari. The hotel is quite large, and we did have to walk a fair way to get to our room. The room was spacious and comfortable with a generous ensuite. There is a huge pool at the hotel. Lovely grounds and lots of birdlife around. There are a couple of choices for meals. We had the buffet for breakfast and dinner and both we well catered with lots of variety.
column13: Great Hotel close to Yala National Park

Our remote location offers tranquility, but we understand it may limit dining and entertainment options without personal transportation facilities. 

We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the comfortable bed and found the service offered by our associates professional and friendly. We will also work on improving the variety in the breakfast offerings. 

Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and provide you with an improved experience in the future.

column12:
This is supposed to be a 5 star resort but from a visual perspective it is pretty tired and a more realistic rating in our opinion would be 3 to 4 stars.

It's location is very remote and without your own transport the hotel is your only option for dining and entertainment, and it's not cheap. We were going to play a game of pool on a table with paper thin felt and several small tears, however an hourly charge of 5000 rupees was not an amount we were prepared to pay.

The pool is nice, the water a good temperature but the surrounding decking is not in good condition. 
We stayed 3 nights which was way too long as there is little to do.
We did enjoy the bed which is large and comfortable with nice big pillows.
Food was okay, there is a good variety for breakfast but each day it was the same.

There is a lot of staff and as with all Sri Lankan service staff they are professional and friendly.

The rooms are very spacious - huge four poster beds and an enormous bathroom with a walk-in shower open to the outside. The bar and restaurant are good and the hotel has a very long pool. Some rooms have views over the sand dunes to the ocean.

column10: Very big wave at the private beach in June, not allowed to go swim at sea as its dangerous. Great for wave watching tho.
column12: Stayed here in June, stayed on 2nd FL. I was disappointed at the infamous design of Jetwing. Although the room is spacious and clean, the bathroom was the size of a basketball court. I find a few really annoying factors: 1) The bathroom ceiling has a gap for use of the sun light, however it‚Äôs letting all the flies and mosquitos in, my room has enough flies in a day and it‚Äôs very very annoying, no mosquito net in bed so you will have flies in your face the whole night, not to mention if you order room service. I suggest to at least put a mosquito net there to keep the mosquito out. Secondly, this gap is letting all the humidity in the bathroom, which means all the clothes and towel hung in the bathroom will never dry. The hangers are the really old school ones that can only be hung inside the closet, there is nowhere else to hang it, consider you have an amazing pool, don‚Äôt you think people will need a place to hang their swim suits? 2) The balcony canopy has no cover but strips of wood, when it rains, the whole balcony is 100% expose to rain, you can‚Äôt sit there and enjoy the view. When you come in June, the waves are super big, you won‚Äôt be allowed to swim in the private beach, please beware, because it‚Äôs dangerous. The only good thing is all the staff here are very friendly , hospitable and polite, they are the only ones who made my stay pleasant. Restaurant has BBQ buffet at night, it‚Äôs amazing!!
column13: Disappointed at design but super nice service!!

I recently stayed at this hotel and would like to share my experience. The hotel itself is attractively designed and offers a pleasant atmosphere. The rooms are clean and well equipped, and the staff are friendly and helpful. However, the rooms are very worn and worn out. Should be renovated .

What is very misleading are the prices on the food and drink menus. Also in the spa area. The prices do not include the tax and the service tip.  This can lead to unpleasant surprises and annoyance.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12: A truly unique place. The safaris offered as part of your stay were terrific and I suspect they're the main reason people stay here. The guides were just terrific: knowledgeable, helpful, engaging, friendly, and courteous.  But the lodge itself is a great destination in its own right. The service was top of the line.  And the food was also just terrific. I opted for one of the rooms with a private plunge pool and was so glad I did. The area teems with wildlife and I was even joined one morning on the deck by a family of monkeys. A wild elephant also made an appearance within view of the main lodge. I had a simply wonderful time and would love to go back.

column12:
My Husband & Son went on a boys trip to wild coast tented lodge for the weekend. We last visited this amazing resort in 2020 and my husband & son were amazed at how they have maintained the resort so well that it still seems as if it is brand new. 

However what always impresses us at every Dilmah hotel / resort is the incredible people working  there and the amazing attention to every detail they put in to giving you better than world class service. 

The team at wild coast has always pampered & spoilt us and this trip has been no different for my husband & son. 

They were warmly greeted at the hotel by Sanduruwan & Sashi the curator who organized their stay. Aishira kept them both entertained with his charm  and ensured they were always looked after with food & drinks in abundance. Aishira‚Äôs special & unique fruit mocktails which he makes off the menu is simply fabulous and a must try. No 2 mocktails are ever the same!! Mostly my Husband & son were incredibly happy to have met Chef Chintaka who made them fabulous customized food for their exact dietary requirements which was simply divine. They were overwhelmed by how kind and attentive he was. He spent time talking to my son and understanding his food preferences and helped introduce him to new foods which is something we really struggle with!!

Honestly we keep coming back because no other hotel treats us this well where we feel like we are surrounded by family. The kindness & joy is infectious. You feel better about everything after a night here. 

We can‚Äôt talk about wild coast tented lodge without talking about the incredible safari into Yala park. My husband & son had the adventure of going on 2 trips into Yala with the well spoken, highly experienced, extremely entertaining and incredibly knowledgeable Ranger Kasun. With his incredible tracking skills of listening to monkey warning calls and observing tracks on the ground my husband & son managed to see leopards on both trips into Yala. On the 2nd trip they had the rare privilege of seeing a female leopard with her cub drinking water together at a watering hole. 

This place is a must visit for any vacation to Sri Lanka. Be it for family‚Äôs, couples or singles. It‚Äôs an experience of a life time. 

Many thanks to all the incredible staff who make this experience possible.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12: My husband and I had an amazing time glamping in one of the cocoon pool suites at the resort. Regarding the overall accommodations, all I can stay that it was stunning. The cocoon suite accommodation was so unique and we enjoyed our pool time in the private pool. Staying in the middle of nature, waking up to bird calls was so beautiful and much needed after living in the urban jungle. Watching the mighty Indian Ocean beat against the beach and rocks was mesmerizing; we could have watched this for hours. Secondly, we had the all-inclusive package and had 2 game drives. We did an afternoon and a morning game drive. Our guide, ranger Kasun, and driver, Kumar, did an excellent job showing us Yala National Park and the various animals, including quickly getting us to a leopard sighting one morning. You can tell how passionate Ranger Kasun was about the animals and preserving nature. Lastly, the service and food at the resort was truly exceptional. We had some long drives and the staff made sure that we always had water and to go snack boxes with us.  All the staff at the bar and restaurant went above and beyond in making sure we were taken care of. All the meals - definitely try all the curries - and drinks were delicious. While we did not do the afternoon tea (because we were so full from breakfast and lunch), we did have the amazing Sri Lankan tea. The canap√©s at the sundowner were also very flavorful. Unfortunately it rained both afternoons we were there so we did the sundowners at the bar rather than the cliff overlooking the ocean. We would love to go back and stay here!
column13: Amazing Glamping Experience in Yala National Park
