column12:
I stayed at Kulu 29/06-01/07 and had an amazing experience. The tents are very comfortable with showers and air conditioning, with a large campsite which offers nice views of a lagoon. The evening and morning safari was very good with lots of unique animals. Our guides, Pramoth and Rohana, had extensive knowledge of the area and could identify various species of birds that were very hard to see. The staff went above and beyond regarding hospitality which enhanced the experience. Also, the food was amazing. 

Overall, the Kulu experience was amazing and a must-do for people looking to visit Yala. 

-George 2024

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column12:
There are so many options for travellers when it comes to accommodation in and around Yala National Park - you really are spoiled for choice.
However.... if it's a genuine safari experience you are looking for, along with the little luxuries that make you feel like you are on holiday  - a stay at Kulu Safari should be at the top of your wish list!

I'm not going to lie, my senses were initially on high alert!! Everything really is tented! You are at one with the nature, without the usual security of 4 walls!  The tent was very rustic, but had everything you needed - a lovely big firm bed, separate shower and toilet, and thankfully.,. A/C!  
After acclimatizing with a sit down on the deck taking it all in, we threw ourselves into Kulu and all it had to offer.

Over the next couple of days, the wonderful Praba and Agith, took us on many adventures. Not sure we have ever seen such a heard working team - Not only were they looking after the camp, but also serving meals (unbelievable Sri Lankan feasts and BBQs), taking us on exciting safaris (which turned out to be be private as we were the only guests over a couple of days) , sharing their expert knowledge on the wildlife, kayaking with us on the lake, and setting up the most breathtaking dinner locations complete, and generally being the most fabulous hosts and companons!

We may not have  seen the elusive leopard in Yala (not through lack of trying!) but a sloth bear sighting , a crocodile kill, and the most unbelievable bird life I have EVER seen, really made it so special.

Breakfast in the treehouse and romantic dinners on the jetty with our own bonfire being watched by the resident crocodiles were out of this world!  

I have stayed in Safari lodges in other parts of the world, but I can tell you that none have been quite as authentic and personal as Kulu.

We came away feeling richer and more grateful that when we arrived - a magical place!

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column10: Avoid using the main gate to Yala
column12:
We had a wonderful time at the Kulu Safari camp.  Praba our guide looked after our every need while in camp and demonstrated an obvious passion and expertise for the wildlife of Yala that we really appreciated.

The camp is lovely and the food amazing.  We particularly enjoyed our dinners out on the dock watching the lightning in the distance and listening to the night chorus.  The tent we stayed in was okay and the excellent air conditioning unit provided relief from the heat however the bathroom could do with a refresh. 

The first afternoon in Yala we were lucky enough to have Praba, the driver and two others from the Kulu team act as spotters which was great.  We had a wonderful leopard sighting along with all sorts of other wildlife.  Each of the drives we saw something amazing with a highlight being an elusive sloth bear crossing the road ahead of us as we were driving out for the evening.

We were fortunate that Kulu Safaris is situated away from the main Yala gate and mainly sticks to less busy areas of the Park.  On our final drive we ventured into the popular part of Yala so we could see the Indian Ocean and it was horrible to say the least.  Far too many vehicles with seemingly minimal respect for the wildlife.  The focus is to get the tourists as close as possible so they can get their 'selfie'.  It was an unfortunate reminder that tourists are both part of the solution and part of the problem of achieving sustainable tourism and how important it is to ensure you are supporting a reputable company that is focused on the welfare of the wildlife and balancing that with giving you a very special experience.

There were parts of Yala that we did not have time to see so we hope to be able to return one day to enjoy the hospitality of Kulu Safaris and their excellent safari vehicle (the best we have experienced in quite some time)
column13: Wonderful experience, great food and excellent guide

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column12:
We are an Indian family of 4 living in Singapore for years now. We have been to quite a few countries, quite a few holidays and some of them were in forests. 
Trust me Kulu Safari and their hospitality was one of the best. We have rarely come across such great hosts in our lives. 

One, its inside Yala National Park. You enter this place and for the rest of the days experience living inside a forest. But in Air Conditioned tents. So you experience both rustic living as well as luxury at the same time. 

Second they have a chef who can create magic with food. The daal, the bitter gourd salad, the banana flower salad, the bbq dinner near the lake, every meal was top class. Also everyday we did dinner at different places in the forest, which was quite an experience. 

Finally must praise the guys who run the day to day affairs in this place. Its a team of father (MD) and his two sons - Pramoth and Ajith. And also the rest of the staff. All were multi taskers. From cooking the food to setting up the meals area in the forest to taking us to jungle safaris inside the forest, they were doing it all. And with a BIG SMILING FACE. Especially Pramoth and Ajith were a hit with our 6 year old twins. They had become more like elder brothers to both the kids and the kids loved them. Must also mention the lady (whose name I forgot) who cut up the food into bite size pieces and fed my son. Such hospitality is hard to find.

Will rate this place 5 star, especially for young kids and their parents. You will love it here, if you love forests, that‚Äôs a guarantee!

Lots of love to Pramoth, Ajith and the whole team of Kulu Safari from all of us.

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column12: This is a tented camp, so if your definition of luxury is carpeting then this isn't for you.  But if your definition of luxury is comfort, cleanliness, excellent food, and being near the exact things you want to see and experience, then you cannot possibly do better.  Moreover, the attentiveness of the staff is better than anywhere we've ever been.  They anticipate needs, provide special experiences, and generally over-the-top care.  We enjoyed our 3 safaris and saw more animal life then we could ever have expected.  Our driver was superb and the naturalist guides were so very knowledgeable.  The nearby park sends an official ranger with each vehicle, and even he was impressed with how well we did.  The meals were fantastic - we even toured the kitchen which was clean and walked the small kitchen garden.  Sometimes they set up means at a small table just a few feet from our very comfortable tent.  The tent itself was on a foundation that was well off the ground, had bathroom and shower, and the beds and towels were quite nice.  The G.M. gave us a tour of the trees and plants in the immediate area - just because we inquired about them.  We've done hikes, safaris, and nature tours for decades, and this is the best place we've ever been.

column10: Go up in the treehouse every morning you can! Not for the faint hearted however! :)
column12:
Cannot recommend this place enough!
There aren‚Äôt enough superlatives to convey how good our stay has been.
The team work so well together to accommodate your stay and their knowledge, respect and friendliness knows no bounds.
With our guides we were lucky enough to see everything we wanted to see and more!
We leave Kulu with a wealth of knowledge, memories and stories that will be told and treasured for a long, long time.
The food is out of this world in a setting that could quite easily be on a different planet.
Everyone here made our stay a pleasure to behold. Our hearts and our bellies are full!
Thank you so much and hopefully, one day, we will see you again soon.

Wonderful place. Beach restaurant is amazing. Service was excellent. Special thanks to the General Manager. Maintain the place well. Spacious room with a panoramic view. Foods were that good. Please give attention chef. We enjoyed the safari very much too.

column10: Only 12 minutes from the Yala Natural Park entance
column12:
This hotel is one of the best located in Sri Lanka and in Yala. It is built on the top of a sandy dune in the middle of wild nature. It is only 12 minutes ride to the Yala Natinal Park Main Entrance. The hotel is organizing Safaris, horse riding and yoga lessons.
Every room is huge and comfortable with big balcony and an amazing sea view.
The hotel general manager, Colonel Udayarathn, is a very fine personality who makes you feel comfortable. He is helping you with any concern and you feel save and protected in the hotel area.
The infinity pool has fantastic emerald color, you can relax or have a little gym excercise.
The architecture of the guest housed  is unique. 
We stayed here for 2 nights in july, the ocean was wild and we had a coninuous salty breeze. The nights were calm and  cool and we slept well in cosy beds.  
All in all we do highly recommend this hotel for people who love nature and relaxation.
column13: Amazing view over the wild ocean

column12: We had an amazing 02 night stay at Layasafari. Excellent facilities and service by the staff.Breakfest and lunch was so delicious. Dip in the pool was a different experience with poolside bar service. Special mention on General Manager -Wasantha' s hospitality and his vision of bali style concept near the pool felt more relaxed. Thanks to good weather the young boys enjoyed quad bike ride on the sand dunes by yhe beach. We also did early morning beach walks which kept us healthy. We certainly recommend more than 02 days at the resort and next time will be a long stay. Wasantha - keep continue with your vision to further take this resort to the next level and we wish you all the best.Laya safari you rock!!!!

column6: {'id': '3748692', 'name': 'Laya Safari', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 745, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.249011, 'longitude': 81.39219, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d3748692-Reviews-Laya_Safari-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/layasafarihotel/', 'address': 'Kirinda-Palatupana-Yala Rd, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kirinda-Palatupana-Yala Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 29, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 71, 'count4': 207, 'count5': 418}}
column12:
Stayed for one night before doing a morning safari.
It was very quiet when we stayed but we had the pool, swing bar etc to ourselves. All staff are very friendly and helpful and attentive.
The evening meal was nice but the breakfast was AMAZING! We had fruit, a selection of bread / pastries then a choice of eggs with chicken ham and hot dog type sausages and toast as well as water, smoothie and coffee - perfect after an early morning safari.
The room was spacious and comfortable with 2 levels separating the bedroom from the living area / balcony and the bathroom was luxurious. We had an upper floor room and the view from the balcony was amazing.
Unfortunately we did not see the elephant but we were awoken by a cow casually eating grass by the pool.

column12:
Hotel staff were very Polite, attentive staff. 
Comfortable accommodation with great views of the beach. 
Apparently an elephant visits the hotel each day but didn‚Äôt see one in our stay. 
Relaxing pool beside the bar and beach. 
Generous breakfast. 
Close to safari. 
Safari was very busy with limited viewing of animals
column13: Perfect hotel on the beach close to safari

column12:
Excellent room fully equipped. Magnificent view over the ocean.
The hotel staff was very professional and friendly. The swimming pool was wonderful. 
But the restaurant was a catastrophe. Unprofessional staff. They served fish and chips with a pan-fried slice of fish with bones. The drinks come after the food was finished. The bread for the soup was also to late.

column10: Please avoid this place, if you do book this place don‚Äôt pay at check in. Consider to look around the place and cleanliness of rooms.
column12: My stay at this hotel was far from satisfactory. The room was of poor quality, the staff, though friendly, were severely inexperienced, and the absence of a buffet on weekends left much to be desired. Adding to the frustration, they charged the full payment upon check-in, leading to a one-hour wait. The lack of tea bags and cleanliness issues further dampened the experience. I've attached photos for reference. While the staff is friendly, their inexperience and management's shortcomings have significantly impacted the hotel's potential. A change in management might be beneficial for the property's future success.
column13: Terrible! Not worth for price at all

column12: Upon arrival we were greeted by a wild Asian elephant in the garden. No kidding. The outside pool area is absolutely gorgeous and perfectly landscaped. Outdoor bali style beach bar and swings. Our room had sea views. Beach walks are just a Stone throw away. The food was buffet style. Everything down to the desert was made with love and set out lovely. The staff were really attending. The location is perfect and only a 10min drive to the safari park which means we were top of the que at 6am when the gates opened.

column10: get sea view room
column12: enjoyed our stay there recently,location is really nice pool area is very impressive the room we had was okay had a couple of issues which staff did try to sort,probably pay the extra for the sea view rooms if im honest.Staff were amazing we got stuck there through a flood and colonel udaya helped us with his own personal vehicle to get passed the water and then booked us a hotel in our next location ,a very big thank you to him.....i personally thought hotel was a little overpriced but its location ,location,location......AND what really made up for the price is the local elephant that i bumped into at 4am that was literally outside our villa ,never had that experience before AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING
